intro: Hieracium ahlfvengrenii, commonly known as the Ahlfven's hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Scandinavia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and rough, hairy foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, featuring basal leaves that are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs. Its yellow flowers appear in late summer, forming a dense cluster at the top of the stem. Hieracium ahlfvengrenii is adapted to rocky and nutrient-poor soils, often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
